pros: Had a great SP, coworkers, and staff. Management treats their employees like people, meaning even MAs / front desk get 410ks and benefits.
cons: This population of patients (poverty, homeless, medicare and Medicaid) is hard to work with at times. Visits are fast, which is a challenge given they need to volume to stay in business.

review_title: Awesome company overall. Unhealthy, toxic administrative office/leadership.
pros: The work done in the community is amazing. The clinics are amazing. The medical staff is absolutely amazing!
cons: The administrative office is in turmoil constantly. The executive Team has turned over twice in two years. Constant restructure, especially in admin office, high turnover, micromanagers, liars and unethical "leaders." So many good, honest people have left voluntarily and otherwise. Toxic and awful!

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Aurora, CO
pros: We work with a great community.
cons: Leadership needs improvement in many areas. Value employees more than their titles.

job_title: Medical Provider in Del Mar, CO
pros: great colleagues good integration of mental health services
cons: operationally poor little provider support

review_title: Great place to make a different in underserved!
pros: -autonomy, lots of female leadership
cons: -fast paced and high acuity for outpatient

job_title: Integrated Behavioral Health Provider in Denver, CO
pros: Feel good about providing medical and mental health in under served communities Feel we make a difference to many Benefits are mostly good, better than some, including good medical, dental, no holiday or on call work. Days go by fast
cons: Fast pace can be tiring. Focus on numbers Limited time for therapy if that is what you are looking for.

pros: You will get to work with the undeserved community and make valuable impacts in their lives.
cons: Not a competitive compensation, there is no uniform way of management. Most clinics do things their own way.

pros: There is a lot of collaboration and a supportive team.
cons: Going through a period of transition

review_title: This company does great things for patients
job_title: Health Education Manager in Denver, CO
pros: This organization serves all populations who slip through the gaps in healthcare. They offer so many other services than just primary care and have so many programs to help people get healthy
cons: It's disorganized, communication from the top down ins't always the best

job_title: Medical Assistant in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Great place to work at.

job_title: Patient Navigator in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: some schedule flexibility, large company with opportunities to switch departments, ability to work with great patients
cons: organization is large and disorganized, with the C-Suite getting insanely high salaries while everyone else gets paid little; frustrating, top-down management style with no room for feedback or comments from the front-line staff

review_title: Great company to gain essential skills and grow
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Denver, CO
pros: Great growth opportunity. Pays fairly well
cons: No work life balance. High employee turn over and burn out

review_title: Make a Difference With your Career
pros: Great pay and benefits, making a difference, cutting edge in healthcare, wonderful CEO, growth, personal development if you make the effort, wonderful support organizations.  I only left because my family grew and I could not figure out how I would balance the needs of the position and my family.
cons: Very fast paced and hard to balance work and life, leadership is working hard to grow and become a stronger team but still has room to improve in communications and employee relations, this is not a job if you only want to collect a paycheck; you have to bring your A-game no matter what job you are in as you are taking care of people that really need you to be at the top of your game!

pros: Nothing good in this company
cons: Manager had favoritism with her permanent employees, treated temp employees differently, bad management

pros: Great clinicians, competitive pay and benefits. Loan repayment as it is low income.
cons:
Support staff overturns frequently, the good ones always leave for better pay. Driven by patient numbers, providers get dinged for no shows if they don't see their minimum patient numbers. I had 2 terrible MAs and kept requesting more help as I was not getting the support I needed and my MA was just put on probation with no retraining or extra support.
15 min appointments for everyone no matter what the problem.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Denver, CO
pros: Lots of learning experience for new Medical Assistants, great for learning multitasking and intergrated health care systems.  Good understanding working with low income  and a wide diverse set of people.
cons: Not enough support for Medical  staff and pay not competitive.

review_title: The medical operations director needs a different aspect on life.
pros: Good work hours.  Prior to the restructuring of operations staff, my old Regional Clinic Operations Manager was amazing.  That changed after the restructuring and that manager went to a different department.
cons: Being  non-profit, the pay isn't what other healthcare facilities pay.

pros: Great coworkers, high speed workplace, and learning different cultures.
cons: High speed workplace, only one pharmacy for 12 different clinics.

pros: Flexible schedules, relaxed working environment
cons: Stagnant movement, raises not given regularly
